oai_dc:dc.dc:descriptions: ...the Moon’s mother, who, according to the first version (begun by ≠kásin, but mainly related by Dia!kwãin), died in consequence of the wrong message delivered to men by the Hare; whereupon the angered Moon split the Hare’s mouth with a stick. (L IV.–4. 3882–3885.) A story about the origin of death in which the Moon beats the Hare for changing the Moon's story around and not telling it properly.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Story of the Moon and the Hare: a version at first by ≠kasin and then by Dia!kwain
